result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Joseph Ortiz Sr

records.addlTxt: All previously ordered conditions remain.

Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz Sr in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Adam Joseph Ortiz Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial. Court passes case to address calendar.

***

Re-called: Same appearances. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Victim is not able to attend, State is requesting an adjournment. Defense moves to dismiss. Speedy trial violated, Court amends cash bond to $2000 signature bond. All conditions of bond remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 15.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz Sr in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Adam Joseph Ortiz Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pre-trial. Case remains in trial posture. Court addressed motions in limine and State's Joinder Motion. 
Court GRANTS Joinder motion and allows case 22CM1440 to be joined with this case. Case remains calendared for jury trial in Br 15.
filed.
State's, filed.
State's, filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Motion for Joinder
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND - EXPIRES 9-13-2022

Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bailbond hearing proceeding. Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense motion.
Defense counsel enters a Speedy Demand for trial.   Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48  hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned.   Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision DISCHARGE Report.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense request a bailbond hearing on case 22cm1440. State to notify victim. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-01-2022
Received and filed
Pretrial Services Violation Report ( New Criminal Charges).
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Court advised defendant the State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Defendant advised this hearing will be held Electronically - via Zoom   
Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM023961  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/2/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with VO
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Adam Joseph Ortiz in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adam Joseph Ortiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to alleged victim in case,   Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
